ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Sandip, You can use the job console (it is a link on the top-right handside in the job detailed page) to run some scripts to retrieve/modify the frontier.

Hi Sandip,

You can use the job console (it is a link on the top-right hand=
side in the
job detailed page) to run some scripts to retrieve/modify the f=
rontier.

These two links have a large set of scripts that you can use.

ht=
tps://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/Heritrix3+Useful+Scripts
ht=
tps://github.com/ukwa/monitrix/tree/master/monitrix-webapp/app/scripts

Reg=
ards,
Ahmed

From:  Archive Crawler <archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com>
Reply=
-To:  Archive Crawler <archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com>
Date:  Tuesday, Mar=
ch 3, 2015 at 11:06 AM
To:  Archive Crawler <archive-crawler@...=
m>
Subject:  [archive-crawler] Queued URIs

 
 
 
 
   

Hi,
My job hangs w=
ith about 30 URI's still in queue .
How do I find out which URI's are still=
 pending  to be crawled ?
I looked at the FrontierSummary and found some 15=
 SNOOZED queues and 15
LONGEST queues.
What do these mean ? I can see both =
of them add to 30 same as my queued
URI's :) 

Also in the snoozed queues I=
 find something like "dns:keydown.tt"  does this
mean some dns look up is f=
ailing which is resulting i n this queue up ?

Is there any way to find why=
 the Job hangs ?


Thanks
Sandip
 
   

 



--B_3508226521_19242053
